PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8543 - Simpler Extensibility in vRealize Automation 7.0 with the Event Broker
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware vRealize Automation has long supported extensibility by adding to the Windows workflows that power it. In recent years, VMware has added support for extensibility through vRealize Operations, but this was always cumbersome and hard to extend without intimate knowledge of the process or a professional services organization engagement. vRealize Automation 7.0 introduced the Event Broker, which makes this very simple while also allowing workflows to be fired from more points in the deployment lifecycle. Come meet with the team that runs the vRealize Automation dogfooding deployment (a.k.a., Project Cava) and that has transitioned their extensive vRealize Operations customization from the workflow stubs to the Event Broker in order to make for simpler integration. This has made blueprint development and troubleshooting much easier and given the team many more extensibility points than were previously available.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7770 - Virtual SAN Management – Time to Level Up Your Ops Game!
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Virtual SAN: You trust its proven ability to run your enterprise applications, top to bottom. You embraced it for your remote office/branch office environments and love its stretched cluster capabilities. And don't get us started on the new dedupe, compression, and erasure coding features in Virtual SAN 6.2. What more could you ask for? How about taking Virtual SAN operations and management to the next level? Yes, the new Virtual SAN management tools built into VMware vCenter provide excellent preflight checks and ongoing insight into Virtual SAN health and performance. But perhaps you need more sophisticated enterprisewide visibility into all of your Virtual SAN environments in one place. Do you need to see performance analytics over time as well as capacity trending and modeling for each of your Virtual SAN environments? Would you like to visualize your underlying physical network health and performance to see if it is impacting Virtual SAN latency? How about a correlated line of site from your virtual machines through the entire topology of your Virtual SAN components? VMware vRealize Operations Manager plus the Management Pack for Storage Devices (MPSD) is the level-up for your Virtual SAN ops game! We will provide live demonstrations of all of these management tools and compare use cases for each solution to help you determine what makes the most sense for your implementation and operational goals. You will walk away Virtual SAN smarter.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7751R - A Technical Deep Dive into VMware Integrated OpenStack
PresentationDetailsList.Description: You may have tried deploying OpenStack either from Operating System package managers or from OpenStack distribution vendors. You heard that VMware has a formal offering in this space, and you want to find out more. This session will begin with an architecture review of the latest OpenStack release and then progress into a deep-dive of VMware Integrated OpenStack internals. We will round out our discussion by covering how VMware solution simplifies “Day 2” OpenStack operations.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8080 - vRealize Reference Architecture: Design, Deploy, and Realize Value at High Speed and Amaze Your Customers!
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Enhance time to value through a persona-based approach using the VMware vRealize suite of products, and realize your customers' needs. Learn how to plan a scalable and performant deployment of vRealize Automation, Operations Manager, Business, and Log Insight, which can be deployed in hours, not days. This discussion will be backed by reference architectures based on live production customers, both internal and external. The presented architectures will include product considerations, networks (load balancers, bandwidth, and latency), and physical requirements (CPU, memory, disk size, and IOPS) that'll enable you to realize your deployment needs in a systematic approach. We will walk you through the design choices and discuss best practices, tuning options, and limitations. Come join us in this highly energetic session and obtain the knowledge you require to plan your vRealize Suite deployment. vRealize IT.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7751 - A Technical Deep Dive into VMware Integrated OpenStack
PresentationDetailsList.Description: You may have tried deploying OpenStack either from Operating System package managers or from OpenStack distribution vendors. You heard that VMware has a formal offering in this space, and you want to find out more. This session will begin with an architecture review of the latest OpenStack release and then progress into a deep-dive of VMware Integrated OpenStack internals. We will round out our discussion by covering how VMware solution simplifies “Day 2” OpenStack operations.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7685R - Insight into the World of Logs with VMware vRealize Log Insight
PresentationDetailsList.Description: How healthy is your VMware vSphere environment? While VMware vCenter may show everything as good, what do the logs say? Are any early warnings buried deep in the million lines of logs? Anyone with vSphere administrator privileges can perform changes that affect many objects. Do you know who did what, and when? You can use logs to answer a variety of practice questions like this. This session will cover everything from performance to configuration, including - Is VMware vSphere Storage Motion causing the performance issue? - Who took a snapshot of which virtual machine (VM), and when? - Which VM needs to be upsized? Which VM hits high CPU usage, and when? - Who powered on or off which VM, and when? - What is the storage latency at the VMkernel level? We will also cover how to architect a global, distributed log management platform using the example of a real-world implementation at a bank: an active/active platform sitting two physical data centers and taking feed from many remote branches. It keeps data for audit and compliance for seven years while keeping other data for a few months.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8770 - Managing Microsoft Azure with the vRealize Suite
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In this session, you'll learn how to create a single pane of glass for consumption and management of Microsoft Azure and other public clouds. One of our customers, McKesson, will also be in attendance to show how they are successfully leveraging VMware vRealize Suite to manage Azure. Topics include governance, cost, and consumption information across Azure and other clouds. We'll conclude with a demo of the functionality and a Q&A with Microsoft Azure Product Manager Guy Bowerman.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8641R - A Lot of Insight and No PowerPoint
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Join VMware vRealize Operations and vRealize Log Insight experts for a lively discussion. In this session, there are no PowerPoint slides, no sales pitches, and no rules! VMware experts are here to answer the audience questions while having some fun in the process. Bring your topics, including anything from operations management of the Software-Defined Data Center to hybrid cloud, capacity, performance, and troubleshooting. No questions are off limits. Experts include, Steve Flanders, staff consulting architect at VMware and leader of Log Insight's customer-oriented R&D; Iwan Rahabok, member of the VMware CTO Ambassador program; Mike Eisenberg, staff systems engineer; and Dave Overbeek, director of technical marketing.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8085 - Save Time With Everything and Anything as a Service (XXXAAS) using vRealize Automation (vRA)
PresentationDetailsList.Description: vRealize Automation has long supported extensibility by adding to the Windows workflows that power it. In recent years it has added support for extensibility through vRO but this was always cumbersome and hard to extend without intimate knowledge of the process or a PSO engagement.

Presenters.Name: Jerome Gudknecht, The Guardian Life Insurance Company of America
Presenters.LastName: Jerome Gudknecht, The Guardian Life Insurance Company of America

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT9184 - Day 2 Automated Operations with vRealize Automation 7.0 and the Event Broker Service, a Deep Dive.
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Have you automated your machine provisioning with vRealize Automation and find yourself buried with managing all of the machines your end users are provisioning? vRealize Automation's Event Broker Service empowers administrators by: 1. Providing a constant stream of state change and machine provisioning data. 2. These data can trigger any workflow in vRealize Orchestrator to perform Day 1 and especially Day 2 activities. 3. Allows for powerful, customizable, and automated reactions to change that was once a manual laborious task. Join us as we jump in the deep end with vRealize Automation Event Broker Service to help transform Day 2 management in your environment.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8641R - A Lot of Insight and No PowerPoint
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Join VMware vRealize Operations and vRealize Log Insight experts for a lively discussion. In this session, there are no PowerPoint slides, no sales pitches, and no rules! VMware experts are here to answer the audience questions while having some fun in the process. Bring your topics, including anything from operations management of the Software-Defined Data Center to hybrid cloud, capacity, performance, and troubleshooting. No questions are off limits. Experts include, Steve Flanders, staff consulting architect at VMware and leader of Log Insight's customer-oriented R&D; Iwan Rahabok, member of the VMware CTO Ambassador program; Mike Eisenberg, staff systems engineer; and Dave Overbeek, director of technical marketing.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT9426-SPO - Best Practices for Cloud Service Data Security
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Data security, compliance, and control are top enterprise concerns when considering a cloud service. Organizations are dealing with increased data security requirements from executives, customers, governments, and regulatory agencies. Attend this session to learn about the data security best practices for clouds and how cloud provider Virtustream has implemented strong data security for mission-critical applications such as SAP.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT9948-SPO - It’s Time to expect more from your Virtual Environment
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Virtualized applications, databases and system resources should be easy to manage but frequently are anything but simple. What if you could have a robust visual picture of your virtual environment and protect data with ZERO data loss? Dell System and Information Management solutions have the intelligence and power to help you reduce downtime, track performance, and respond to issues BEFORE they occur. The result? You save valuable time every day while delivering consistent dependable service to your users. It time to EXPECT more so you can deliver MORE.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7759 - Early VVD Adopter Experience: Building a Secure and Automated Cloud
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Presenting the work done during the building of VVD using Intel Lab in Pisa-Italy. The initiatives bring the collaboration between local Team of VMware PSO and Intel to test and build an entire lab from scratch using the reference architecture provided by VVD. Challenges, pros & cons of the VVD architecture and how it helped in fast delivery an automated Cloud.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8332 - How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the vRealize Automation API
PresentationDetailsList.Description: APIs are one of the foundational requirements for automation. Join us as we explore the VMware vRealize Automation API, and learn how to use it to achieve consumer-centric use cases, such as provisioning and managing applications. It also helps when performing repetitive administration tasks, simplifying the care and feeding of your vRealize Automation deployment. We will demonstrate a variety of practical use cases and pull back the curtain to show how automation is done. We'll also provide resources you can use to jump-start your own automation efforts.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7685R - Insight into the World of Logs with VMware vRealize Log Insight
PresentationDetailsList.Description: How healthy is your VMware vSphere environment? While VMware vCenter may show everything as good, what do the logs say? Are any early warnings buried deep in the million lines of logs? Anyone with vSphere administrator privileges can perform changes that affect many objects. Do you know who did what, and when? You can use logs to answer a variety of practice questions like this. This session will cover everything from performance to configuration, including - Is VMware vSphere Storage Motion causing the performance issue? - Who took a snapshot of which virtual machine (VM), and when? - Which VM needs to be upsized? Which VM hits high CPU usage, and when? - Who powered on or off which VM, and when? - What is the storage latency at the VMkernel level? We will also cover how to architect a global, distributed log management platform using the example of a real-world implementation at a bank: an active/active platform sitting two physical data centers and taking feed from many remote branches. It keeps data for audit and compliance for seven years while keeping other data for a few months.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7899 - Whose Hand Is in the Cookie Jar? Reducing the Mean Time to Innocence Using vRealize Operations
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Even as information technology trends work toward simplifying architecture, complexities are still evident. So how can we quickly determine the root cause of an issue? Utilizing VMware vRealize Operations as a data aggregator, we are able to collectively assemble key performance indicators and relevant data in a single-management user interface. The robust user interface provides an all-encompassing view by automatically mapping dependencies within an environment and aggregating data in a single location. The dependencies and data aggregation provide a detailed level of insight from the application/database through the virtual layer and down to the underlying hardware. Using vRealize Operations, we are able to quickly access data across endpoints, determine the impact they impose on the rest of the environment, and quickly determine the root cause of an issue.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT9457 - Understanding the Value of vRealize Network Insight
PresentationDetailsList.Description: As you know, VMware had recently acquired Arkin for its top-notch NSX management tools. Join this session to learn how vRealize Operations, together with vRealize Network Management (formerly Arkin) can help you run your virtual networks better. Hear it from Arkin subject matter experts first hand. See real-live demo. - Microsegmentation and security- Comprehensive netflow assessment and analysis to model security groups and firewall rules - Make micro-segmentation easier to deploy with recommendations- Continuously monitor and audit compliance postures over time- 360 visibility and correlation across virtual and physical networks- Virtual and physical network topology mapping- Performance Optimization across Overlay and Underlay- NSX Management & operations- Ensure NSX Health and Performance - Initiative UI with natural language search for troubleshooting-Best practice compliance checking

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8733R - Application Self-Service with On-Demand Networking & Security from vRealize Automation and NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Learn how vRealize Automation and NSX optimize IT demand by reducing delivery time from weeks to minutes. This session will cover the self-service catalog delivery of applications including their on-demand networking and security needs through integration of VMware vRealize Automation and NSX solutions.
This empowers organizations to supply business services in an automated fashion with minimal touch points and faster delivery. Users can create blueprints which combine OS, compute, storage, networking and security services, including micro-segmentation for self-service IT. A live demonstration will highlight the benefits your organization can gain.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8486 - NSX Operations with vRealize Suite
PresentationDetailsList.Description: NSX adoption - skyrocketing off the charts! Join us to learn more about the new best of breed VMware tools for operationalizing NSX – vRealize Network Insight (formerly Arkin) and vRealize Log Insight. Correlate logical network overlays with physical device underlays. Built-in micro-segmentation planning at multiple hierarchical levels. Security auditing. Troubleshooting and alerting. Availability and performance management. Charts. Graphs. Topology Diagrams. Dashboards. Enough log analytics to make a network engineer salivate. Tightly integrated with NSX, vRealize Network Insight and vRealize Log Insight are Must-Haves for your Network, Security, and VI Ops teams.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT9615-SPO - vRealize the Possibilities:  Application Agility and Rapid Deployment with vRealize Automation, Orchestration, Operations and Log Insight
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Enterprises have a strong desire to automate their entire IT infrastructure and applications to ensure a reliable and repeatable application environment. This session will review how to automate provisioning, configuration, monitoring and troubleshooting and resolution of application performance. This presentation will walk customers through a real word scenario where an application is provisioned, configured, monitored and scaled using the vRealize tool set. Our demo will take attendees through the following scenario: • Provision a web based application, layer 2-3 networking and layer 4-7 services utilizing vRealize Automation, configure application services and Application Delivery Controllers using vRealize Orchestration. • Diagnose access and other security log information with vRealize Log Insight • Monitor your entire application environment from the application server, to the load balancer with vRealize Operations. Diagnose and troubleshoot potential application bottlenecks with vRealize Operations • Address performance bottlenecks by provisioning new application resources with vRealize Automation and vRealize Orchestration

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8984 - From Zero to SDDC at a Major Telco
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Come to our session and learn how a major telecommunications company started with a consolidation project and evolved into an agile, fluid private cloud with the help of VMware vRealize Suite Enterprise. We will walk you through the company's challenges, lessons learnt, and real-life incremental successes, including how it achieved cost savings of up to 90 percent and reduced provisioning of resources from months to days.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7671 - What's New in VMware Integrated OpenStack Version 3.0!
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Integrated OpenStack is an exciting product, and we want you to come learn about the latest release. Based on the Mitaka release, this version will include the latest features that are important to OpenStack consumers and operators.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7752 - OpenStack in the Real World: VMware Integrated OpenStack Customer Panel
PresentationDetailsList.Description: You may have heard how great VMware Integrated OpenStack is, but does the framework actually deliver on the industry's expectations? Join us as we discuss with our customers how they are using OpenStack and the benefits that it provides to application developers and IT operators.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8763 - 3 Best Practices for IT to Enable Developers to Deploy on Amazon and Azure While Ensuring Security and Accountability
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Enable developers in your organization to move quickly on public cloud and hold them accountable at the same time. Deliver a component that is usable and posseses all the IT factors for governance. These include creating security groups, regulating network access, enabling self-service, provisioning and providing access through a cloud management platform, and allowing access and integration to third-party tools in a controlled way.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8768 - How TIAA Uses an API-Centric Cloud Management Platform to Allow Applications to Be Easily Deployed and Managed on Both Public and Private Clouds
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Learn how TIAA is using a cloud management portal to deeply integrate multiple private and public clouds such as VMware, Amazon Web Services, and Azure, deliver self-service, automate to eliminate handoffs, govern usage, manage costs, and ultimately increase business focus.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7629R - 360-Degree Troubleshooting
PresentationDetailsList.Description: How can you troubleshoot issues quickly to get the root of problems in your environment? By leveraging the power of VMware vRealize Operations and VMware vRealize Log Insight together. We will cover how to achieve the best level of integration between the solutions, and then show you how to dig into the data and get to the root of a problem. This session is a must for anyone in a VI admin or firefighting role. Expect a technical deep dive with very few slides.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT9220 - vRealize Automation and NSX Design Experts Panel
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The business and operational benefits of incorporating on-demand networking and security into application design are indisputable, but do you have what it takes to transition from conceptual design to production? While VMware vRealize Automation has provided enhanced networking and security integration in the form of VMware NSX in the past, the latest release, vRealize Automation 7.x, ups the ante to make building, consuming, and lifecycle managing application-centric network services a core function of service delivery. Attend this experts panel to learn how to deploy, integrate, and manage NSX for vRealize Automation consumption.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8762 - How to Set Up a Multicloud IT Portal to Deploy, Manage, and Control Applications on Private and Public Clouds
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Streamline and automate onboarding processes for users and apps onto public clouds. Allow your developers to set up and use cloud resources themselves. Set up automated governance and policies so users can operate within their defined limits and use appropriate policies. Provide insight into system health and capacity so you can ensure service-level agreements are met and predict future needs.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8807 - What's New in vRealize Code Stream
PresentationDetailsList.Description: "Transforming application releases to continuous delivery is easy." This is not something that you normally hear someone say. Because every application release process has its own set of tools and nuances, how do you tie them all into a single, coherent release process? You need an overarching solution that takes all your release tools and processes and strings them up into an automation instrument for push-button application deployment confidence and end-to-end visibility. VMware vRealize Code Stream is one such solution that releases automation and, at the same time, integrates deeply with other VMware automation products such as vRealize Automation and vRealize Orchestrator along with many of the other tools in your typical SDLC environment. vRealize Code Stream 2.1 is hot off the press and packed with lots of exciting improvements—it's our best release yet. We have achieved significant changes under the hood that will further enhance the speed at which you can deliver your applications, and to top it off, we have added more third-party integration and reporting capabilities. In this session, you will get an overview of all the new capabilities we offer in vRealize Code Stream 2.1, including a detailed walkthrough of all the new third-party integrations and the improvements made to application release visibility through reporting. We'll also demo how a release pipeline can take a developer-initiated application change through various stages of a typical release process, including automated testing, staging, and finally production. This presentation will also show how the integration mechanisms of vRealize Code Stream work together with both VMware and third-party tools.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8733R - Application Self-Service with On-Demand Networking & Security from vRealize Automation and NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Learn how vRealize Automation and NSX optimize IT demand by reducing delivery time from weeks to minutes. This session will cover the self-service catalog delivery of applications including their on-demand networking and security needs through integration of VMware vRealize Automation and NSX solutions.
This empowers organizations to supply business services in an automated fashion with minimal touch points and faster delivery. Users can create blueprints which combine OS, compute, storage, networking and security services, including micro-segmentation for self-service IT. A live demonstration will highlight the benefits your organization can gain.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7737 - Intelligent Operations Management: A Customer Perspective
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Cloud computing forces IT organizations to rethink how they manage their data centers. Progressive IT organizations become service providers, striving to accelerate service delivery while maintaining control and reducing costs. This sounds great in theory, but the key question is, "What can you do today to better manage your data center and create an on-ramp to cloud?" In this panel session, four VMware customers will present their experiences, discuss what tools and processes they've implemented, and share some of the results they're seeing in their own organizations. Finally, we'll review best practices and some tips and tricks and talk about how to overcome potential pitfalls. We haven't finalized our list of panelists yet, but you can expect companies like ExactTarget, EMC, Autotrader, and UnitedHealthcare.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7629R - 360-Degree Troubleshooting
PresentationDetailsList.Description: How can you troubleshoot issues quickly to get the root of problems in your environment? By leveraging the power of VMware vRealize Operations and VMware vRealize Log Insight together. We will cover how to achieve the best level of integration between the solutions, and then show you how to dig into the data and get to the root of a problem. This session is a must for anyone in a VI admin or firefighting role. Expect a technical deep dive with very few slides.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8902-QT - Process, Process, Process, And Then Tools
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The Optum Technology public-private cloud journey began in 2008. Gather around the campfire as we describe how we integrated first and improved processes later and talk about the challenges we faced along the way. The session will end with a discussion of the recent enablement of a transformation agenda that includes the VMware vRealize stack and VMware NSX.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8751-QT - Be the IT Hero of Your Company and Discover How to Save Thousands of Dollars by Reclaiming Underutilized CPU, Memory, and Disk Resources
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Are you still running a naked VMware vSphere environment? Let us help you discover how to optimize your virtual infrastructure by applying an industry-leading assessment. We will introduce the vSphere Optimization Assessment, a simple, powerful new tool that helps optimize your data center and reclaim wasted resources, resulting in thousands of dollars in savings. This free, enhanced evaluation delivers a comprehensive analysis of the optimization opportunities in your virtualized environment and starts analyzing the data to help you - Identify misconfigured clusters, hosts, and virtual machines - Assess performance problems and their root causes - Reclaim underutilized CPU, memory, and disk space - Run scenario-based capacity planning and modeling - Gain visibility into the costs associated with unused resources.We will outline the custom reports available only with this assessment and walk you through the most relevant areas to help you focus on optimization opportunities—allowing you to become the IT hero in your organization.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7782-QT - Automating Resource Reclamation in the Modern Data Center
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Ever wondered why that virtual machine (VM) that no one knows who owns is still running and can't be turned off? What about those developers who keep deploying VMs but never turn them off and leave them behind, moving onto the next shiny object. Well, we have a way to keep all parties happy and reduce the VM sprawl at the same time. Sounds like nirvana right? Well, have no fear. By using VMware vRealize Operations integrated with vRealize Automation, we can automate the shutdown and the control of idle VMs all while ensuring the end user has complete visibility and notification with no human intervention. Through a demo and presentation, we will walk you through how we achieved this outcome and help you better understand what benefits this can bring to your organization.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8355-QT - Tutorial: Build a data-driven story around capacity planning using VMware vRealize® Operations™ and third-party Management Packs
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Capacity planning and optimization are just as critical in a hosted private cloud as they are in an enterprise data center or colocation. Enterprises that need the security and isolation of a single-tenant environment in the cloud have the same challenges with knowing when capacity changes are needed as they do on-premises.

As one of the largest VMware service providers, Rackspace has worked with Virtualization Infrastructure Admins and Architects across enterprise customers to capture their capacity utilization metric needs, and leverage the extensibility and the “What-If” capacity planning functionality of vRealize® Operations™ (vROps) to provide their customers with the data that they need to plan for future demand.

In this breakout session, Rackspace Product Architect, John Davis (VCAP5-DCD), will help you identify useful capacity utilization metrics in vROps as well as in third-party plugins (Management Packs). By using add-on Management Packs, you will learn how to create custom views and calculate Super Metrics that give you visibility from the networking layer down to the storage layer.
